actions.committee: House Committee on Banking, Finance and Urban Affairs
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Banking, Finance and Urban Affairs.

committees.committee: House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to amend the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 to provide that the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System shall not deny any application for the formation of a one-Bank holding company because the transaction to form such one-bank holding company involves a bank stock loan which is for a period of not more than 25 years.

summary.text: Amends the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 to provide that the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System shall not deny any application for the formation of a one-bank holding company because the transaction to form such one-bank holding company involves a bank stock loan which is for a period of not more than 25 years.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 to provide that the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System shall not deny any application for the formation of a one-Bank holding company because the transaction to form such one-bank holding company involves a bank stock loan which is for a period of not more than 25 years.
